definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: Your raw wool scarf is so beautiful; where did you buy it?
sentences.chinese: 你这条原毛围巾真漂亮，是从哪儿买的？

sentences.english: The box that the fur came out of was on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 装狐皮围巾的那只盒子放在床上。

sentences.english: Acrylic blankets and shawls are both warm and washable.
sentences.chinese: 丙烯酸纤维的毯子和围巾又保暖又耐洗。

sentences.english: Five pieces of coal, a carrot, and a scarf are lying on the lawn.
sentences.chinese: 五块煤，一个胡萝卜，一条围巾在草地上。

sentences.english: Her kerchief is dirty with oil.
Her flared her scarf to catch my eye.
sentences.chinese: 她炫示她的围巾以引我注目。

sentences.english: So I like rings, scarfs and sunglasses.
sentences.chinese: 因此我喜欢耳环围巾和太阳镜。

sentences.english: They bought many scarf, cotton windcheater and leather shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他们买了围巾，棉风衣和皮鞋。

sentences.english: Young women were always interested in the trends of fashion, She was tricked to buy a scarf made of a triangular piece of blue silk.
sentences.chinese: 她被哄骗买了一条三角形的兰色丝绸围巾。

sentences.english: I also have a hat, a scarf and mittens.
sentences.chinese: 我还戴着帽子，围巾和连指手套。

sentences.english: It is 4.30am when we step back out into the ruins in jackets and scarves.
sentences.chinese: 我们穿上外套，带着围巾再次回到遗址。

sentences.english: Those scarfs are in this year.
We want to buy Scarves, Stoles, Pareos and Made-Ups, Shawls.
sentences.chinese: 我们要采购围巾，女用坎肩，海滩裙和装扮，披肩。

sentences.english: She wrapped her shawl closer about her.
Stop yanking at my shawl; I can't breathe.
sentences.chinese: 别拉着我的围巾不放，我不能呼气了。

definition: cape/shawl/(of long hair) to trail over one's shoulders
